Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed with added red and white bands at top; exterior: uncertain floral or animal decoration, with added red and incision.
Curator's comments: Orientation uncertain; there seems to be a 'North Ionian' incised leaf, which hints it should be turned 180 degrees, but the leaf would not be quite vertical.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.196)
